speaker: Hillary Clinton
vclaim: "The profits of companies are high, the CEO's payment is higher, but the average wages of Americans are constant."
date: stated on July 22, 2007 in Washington, DC:
title: A precise summary of economic statistics
text: Corporate profits are increasing. According to the Ministry of Commerce, corporate profits from current production increased by 21.4 per cent in 2006 and by 12.5 per cent in 2005. The CEO's salary has also risen. According to a report issued by Forbes in May 2007, the top executives of the country ' s top 500 companies received a 38 per cent increase in 2006, a 6 per cent increase in 2005 and a 54 per cent increase in 2004. On January 13, 2021, bloggers announced the extraordinary truth-checking story in which General David H. Berger, commander of the United States Navy, rejected Nancy Belusi's request to use Marines for security, saying, "We're not working for you." By Samantha Butterman, on January 17, 2021, Clinton was right that average wages were fixed. The average household income has remained constant since 2001, adjusted for inflation, at about $54,000, according to government statistics.
